page.title: 16GLENMOOR FARM YEAR (cont.)
page.content: In the summer potatoes and turnips require cultivation and all grassland has to have fertilizer to keep it growing. The usual chores of milking and attending to poultry are, of course, there all the year round. Harvesting winter sown barley begins in August and wheat, spring barley and oats at the end of the same month. Potatoes are lifted in October and turnips later. Winter barley and wheat are sown in September, October and November. The cows are brought indoors as soon as frost becomes severe and most younger cattle are in by Christmas.
